title: The Euclid space telescope is coming together
Euclid moving into final phase of testing following integration milestone
summary: The European Space Agency’s (ESA’s) Euclid space telescope has moved closer to launch after prime contractor Thales Alenia Space mated the spacecraft’s service module and payload module. Euclid will aim to study the “dark universe” through visible-light and near-infrared astronomy. The mission had been slated to launch no earlier than the first quarter of 2023, but this is now expected to be delayed due to an enforced change of launch vehicle.

title: Falcon 9 leading candidate to launch European science mission
summary: A European astrophysics spacecraft stranded when Russia cut off access to Soyuz launch vehicles may instead fly on a SpaceX Falcon 9, NASA officials said Oct. 17.

title: ESA moves two missions to Falcon 9
summary: The European Space Agency now plans to launch a space telescope and an asteroid mission on Falcon 9 rockets because of its loss of access to Soyuz vehicles and delays in the introduction of the Ariane 6.

title: SpaceX to launch Europe’s next deep space telescope, first asteroid orbiter
summary: On October 17th, a NASA official speaking at an Astrophysics Advisory Committee meeting revealed that the European Space Agency (ESA) had begun...

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX to launch Euclid; Virgin Galactic to fly crewed suborbital mission
summary: Four launches are planned for the week of June 24 to July 1. The Russians are planning to launch a Meteor weather satellite aboard a Soyuz rocket on Tuesday, June 27, and Virgin Galactic plans to fly its Galactic 01 crewed suborbital mission no earlier than Thursday, June 29. Firefly’s Alpha rocket is thought to be making its first operational flight with the DARPA Victus Nox mission no earlier than the last week of June, and SpaceX plans to end the week with the launch of the European Space Agency’s (ESA) Euclid telescope for on Saturday, July 1.

title: SpaceX to launch the Euclid Space Telescope for the European Space Agency
summary: SpaceX is targeting no earlier than July 1st at 11:11 a.m. ET (15:11 UTC) for the launch of the European Space Agency’s...

title: SpaceX to launch European astronomy mission
summary: A European spacecraft is set to launch on a mission to help astronomers resolve an “embarrassing situation” in cosmology, although the launch itself is another kind of embarrassing situation for Europe.

title: SpaceX to launch ESA’s Euclid Telescope to explore the dark universe
summary: SpaceX is on track for the launch of its 45th mission of the year, which will carry the Euclid telescope from the European Space Agency (ESA). Liftoff is set for this Saturday, July 1, at 11:12 AM EDT (15:12 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) in Florida.
